Metadata.Label: Lung RADS

References.Citation: Kazerooni EA, Austin J, Black WC, Dyer DS, Hazelton T, Leung AN, McNitt-Gray MF, Munden RF, Pipavath S. ACR-STR Practice Parameter for the Performance and Reporting of Lung Cancer Screening Thoracic Computed Tomography (Resolution 4). Journal of Thoracic Imaging 2014;29(5):310-316

Diagram.Label: ACR Lung Imaging Reporting and Data System (Lung-RADS) Assessment Categories

Contact.Name: Tarik Alkasab, MD, PhD
Contact.Institution: Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School

Metadata.ReportCitationText: Lung cancer screening categorization and recommendations per American College of Radiology Lung-RADS Version 1.0 (http://www.acr.org/Quality-Safety/Resources/LungRADS).

IntegerDataElement.Label: What is the most suspicious image number

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Can this lung image be evaluated?
Nodule 1: What is the unit of this nodule?
Nodule 1: Composition
Category of findings
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Lung-RADS category based on the paper

Choice.Label: 0: Lungs cannot be evaluated
Choice.Hint: Part or all of lungs cannot be evaluated

Choice.Label: 2: Perifissural Nodule: <10 mm(523.6mm³)
Choice.Hint: Perifissural nodule(s) : <10 mm

Choice.Label: 2: Sol <6 mm (113.1 mm³)/ new <4 mm ( 33.5 mm³)
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s):<6 mm new <4 mm

Choice.Label: 2: Part-sol <6mm (113.1 mm³) total diameter on baseline screening
Choice.Hint: Part solid nodule(s):<6 mm total diameter on baseline screening

Choice.Label: 2: GGN <30mm (14137.2 mm³)/ >=30mm(14137.2 mm³) slow grow
Choice.Hint: Non-solid nodul(s) (GGN):<30 mm OR >=30 mm and unchanged or slowly growing

Choice.Label: 2: Category 3 or 4 stable >=3 months
Choice.Hint: Category 3 or 4 nodules unchanged for >= 3 months

Choice.Label: 3: Sol >=6 to <8mm(> 113.1 to < 268.1 mm³) / new 4 mm to<6mm(> 33.5 to < 113.1 mm³)
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s): >=6 to <8 mm at baseline OR new 4 mm to < 6 mm

Choice.Label: 3: Part-sol >6 mm (>113.1mm³) with sol <6mm(<113.1mm³) / new <6mm(<113.1mm³) total diameter
Choice.Hint: Part solid nodule(s):>6 mm total diameter with solid component <6 mm OR new <6 mm total diameter

Choice.Label: 3: GGN >=30mm(> 14137.2 mm³) on baseline CT or new
Choice.Hint: Non-solid nodule(s) (GGN) >=30 mm on baseline CT or new

Choice.Label: 4A: Sol >=8 to <15mm (>= 268.1 to < 1767.1 mm³)/ growing <8mm (268.1mm³)/ new 6 to <8 mm(113.1 to <268.1 mm³)
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s): >=8 to <15 mm at baseline OR growing <8 mm OR new 6 to <8 mm

Choice.Label: 4A: Part-sol>6mm(113,1mm³) with solid component >=6 mm to <8 mm(113.1 to 268.1 mm³)/ with a new or growing <4 mm (<33.5 mm³)solid component
Choice.Hint: Part-solid Nodule(s):>=6 mm with solid component >=6 mm to <8 mm OR with a new or growing <4 mm solid component

Choice.Label: 4B: Sol >=15 mm (1767.1 mm³)/ new or growing, and >=8mm(268.1 mm³)
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s):>= 15 mm OR new or growing, and >= 8 mm

Choice.Label: 4B: Part-sol with a solid component >= 8 mm (268.1 mm³)/ a new or growing >= 4 mm (33.5 mm³) solid component
Choice.Hint: Part-solid Nodule(s) with: a solid component >= 8 mm OR a new or growing >= 4 mm solid component

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Are there any other nodules present?

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Are there any clinical significant finding?

Choice.Label: Coronary arterial calcification moderate or severe
Mass (check neck, mediastinum, liver, kidneys, other), which they have to specify
Other interstitial lung disease (UIP/IPF, ILD other or ILD unknown)

Branch.ReportText: Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examination.
Continue annual screening with low-dose chest CT in 12 months.
Follow up low-dose chest CT in 6 months.
Follow-up low dose chest CT in 3 months or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.
Tissue sampling, chest CT with or without contrast, or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.
Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examination.

Part or all of the lungs cannot be evaluated.
perifissural nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size and/or lack of growth.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size and/or lack of growth.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
partly-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
non-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size or lack of growth.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
In view of the stability of findings for 3 months, the nodule has reverted to category 2 with very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to lack of growth.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.
partly solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.
non-solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.

partly-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
non-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size or lack of growth.

In view of the stability of findings for 3 months, the nodule has reverted to category 2 with very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to lack of growth.
The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.
partly solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.
non-solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer.
Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examination.
Continue annual screening with low-dose chest CT in 12 months.
Follow up low-dose chest CT in 6 months.
Follow-up low dose chest CT in 3 months or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.
Tissue sampling, chest CT with or without contrast, or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.
